intro: Hubertia alleizettei, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and thick, waxy leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often with a red throat. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as deep root systems and water-storing tissues. Due to its ornamental value and resilience, it is cultivated in gardens in regions with warm, dry climates.
